title: Mobile Microlearning Course to Strengthen Digital Fluency Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental digital tool proficiency and practical experience in specialized fields (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: A non-degree professional-oriented science education program conducted in a smartphone-centered limited technology environment

learning_goals: Learners can apply five core digital literacy skills—information evaluation, data analysis, digital collaboration, security management, and creative problem-solving—with 80% or higher accuracy.
Learners can design and establish implementation plans for three or more customized digital tool utilization scenarios by specialty.
Learners can analyze two ethical dilemma cases and propose alternatives based on critical thinking about digital environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
